en.headline: What is Google Analytics 4 (GA4)?
en.text:
Google Analytics 4 (GA4) is the latest version of Google's analytics service, designed to provide a deeper understanding of user interactions across websites and applications. GA4 uses an event based data model that provides a more flexible and granular view of user behavior than its predecessor, Universal Analytics. This model enables cross-platform and cross-device tracking and integrates data into a single user journey. Features such as advanced measurement options automatically track actions such as scrolling, outgoing clicks, site searches and video engagement without additional encoding.

Although GA4 offers advanced tracking and integration capabilities, some users find the transition complicated or are looking for alternatives that meet specific privacy requirements or user-friendly interfaces. At this point, Pirsch Analytics becomes a viable alternative.

Google Analytics 4 (GA4) Alternative

Pirsch Analytics stands out for its simplicity and its data protection approach. In contrast to Google Analytics 4, whose setup and administration can be complex, Pirsch offers an straightforward, simple analytics interface that focuses on the essentials. This makes it particularly attractive for small to medium-sized companies that need effective analysis without a steep learning curve. Pirsch is also GDPR-compliant out of the box, ensuring that user data is handled with high data protection standards without the need for additional configuration.

In addition, Pirsch Analytics does not use cookies, which means that no banners are required for cookie consent, which can impair the user experience and make compliance more difficult. This cookie-free approach not only makes it easier to comply with privacy laws, but also allows for more accurate tracking as more users block or limit cookies. By switching to Pirsch, companies can enjoy a cleaner, more user-friendly analytics solution that respects users' privacy and reduces legal issues. This makes Pirsch the ideal choice for anyone looking to move away from the complexity of GA4.
